title: 2 Men Convicted of Killing Malcolm X Will Be Exonerated Decades Later
content: The 1966 convictions of the two men are expected to be thrown out after a lengthy investigation, validating long-held doubts about who killed the civil rights leader.

more_info.byline: By Ashley Southall and Jonah E. Bromwich

title: Overdose Deaths Reached Record High as the Pandemic Spread
content: More than 100,000 Americans died from drug overdoses in the yearlong period ending in April, government researchers said.

title: Vaccinated vs. Unvaccinated: Europe’s Covid Culture War
content: In pockets of Europe, vaccine resistance has become the long tail of the populist nationalist movements that shook up European politics for a decade.

title: How Americans’ Appetite for Leather in Luxury SUVs Worsens Amazon Deforestation
content: An examination of Brazil’s immense tannery industry shows how hides from illegally deforested ranches can easily reach the global marketplace. In the United States, much of the demand for Brazilian leather comes from automakers.

more_info.byline: By Manuela Andreoni, Hiroko Tabuchi, Albert Sun and Victor Moriyama

title: Catholic Bishops Avoid Confrontation With Biden Over Communion
content: In a vote, they endorsed new guidance on offering holy communion to public figures but did not overtly mention the president or other officials who support abortion rights.

org_facet: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops

title: House is Set to Censure Paul Gosar for Violent Video
content: The Democratic-led House is expected to formally rebuke the Arizona Republican, meting out a rarely used punishment for the first time in over a decade.

more_info.byline: By Catie Edmondson and Jonathan Weisman

title: Jan. 6 Defendant Known as QAnon Shaman Sentenced to 41 Months
content: Jacob Chansley, who wore a horned helmet and a fur pelt as he stormed onto the Senate floor during the Capitol riot, had earlier pleaded guilty to a single felony count.

title: A Green Light at the Window for Migrants
content: An unofficial network of local residents, activists and volunteer medics in Poland has been working to support those who have made it across from Belarus in freezing conditions.

title: How the Belarus Standoff Is Unlike Recent Migrant Crises
content: The images at the Belarus-Poland border look familiar, but this emergency has little in common with previous waves of people from Syria, Myanmar and Afghanistan.

des_facet: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis

title: The Fight of This Old Boxer’s Life Was With His Own Family
content: Marvin Stein lived an eventful and prosperous life. But a battle among his family over his fortune broke out in his 89th year, and he suddenly found himself powerless to fight for himself.

title: A Beginner’s Thanksgiving: 7 Recipes That Lighten the Workload
content: For first-time cooks, or anyone looking to simplify the holiday prep, this special menu minimizes effort and maximizes flavor.

title: One Chaste Marriage, Four Kids, and the Catholic Church
content: A son reflects on his parents’ commitment, endorsed by the Catholic Church, to cohabit chastely like “brother and sister” to avoid mortal sin.

title: Up, Up and Away: The Trippy Tales Behind ‘Flying Over Sunset’
content: How’s this for an unlikely idea for a musical? Three 1950s celebrities, including Cary Grant, experimenting with LSD. Together. It happened, sort of.

title: What We See in the Shameful Trends on U.S. Maternal Health
content: Especially for women of color.

title: Democrats Shouldn’t Panic. They Should Go Into Shock.
content: “No administration is going to thrive in that economic environment.”

content: This is what happened when the West looked away from my country.

title: What if Your Kids Never Let You Sleep Again?
content: You can’t control your children’s sleep. And you probably don’t have to.

title: Want to Save the Earth? We Need a Lot More Elon Musks.
content: To slow climate change, Father Profit and New Tech must innovate, fast.

content: Donald Trump was right to fire James Comey.

title: Are We Witnessing the Mainstreaming of White Power in America?
content: A historian of the white power movement discusses Jan. 6, Tucker Carlson and the threat of politically motivated violence.

content: The situation at the Belarus-Poland border is unlike recent immigration crises.

title: The School Board Wars, Part 2
content: Meetings of the Central Bucks school board devolve into ugly fights and a bitter election is nearing. But what’s actually happening in classrooms?

title: What the Metaverse Sounds Like to Hans Zimmer
content: The composer discusses how streaming and A.I. are transforming movie music.

title: How a Cure for Gerrymandering Left U.S. Politics Ailing in New Ways
content: Independent commissions to oversee the redrawing of electoral maps were thought to be the solution to an age-old problem. Instead, they have become bogged down in political trench warfare.

title: Hotter Summer Days Mean More Sierra Nevada Wildfires, Study Finds
content: The research adds to a growing body of work finding that climate change is increasing fire risk in California and elsewhere in the West.

title: The DNA of Roma People Has Long Been Misused, Scientists Reveal
content: An op-ed in Nature calls for higher ethical standards in the usage and analysis of genetic information from the Romani, a marginalized group in Europe.

title: Where Are Young People Most Optimistic? In Poorer Nations.
content: More than half of Americans, young and old, say children today will be less economically successful than their parents, a global survey shows.

title: As gas prices surge, President Biden asks the F.T.C. to investigate ‘illegal conduct.’
content: President Biden asked the Federal Trade Commission to look into whether big oil companies are fueling a spike in gas prices.

title: Oklahoma Governor and Pentagon Standoff Over Vaccines Intensifies
content: The state says its National Guard members don’t need to get vaccinated. Pentagon officials say a failure to follow “valid medical readiness requirements” could “jeopardize” the status of troops.

des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

title: Idaho Lawmaker Is Censured for Doxxing Intern Who Reported Rape
content: Priscilla Giddings, an Idaho state representative, shared a student intern’s personal information after the teenager accused another lawmaker of rape.

title: Miramax Sues Quentin Tarantino Over Planned ‘Pulp Fiction’ NFTs
content: The director announced this month he was selling nonfungible tokens based on the screenplay for his 1994 movie. Miramax asserted in court documents it still has “broad rights” to the film.

title: Professor Cited as Corruption Expert Is Sentenced for Money Laundering
content: A former University of Miami international studies professor used bank accounts in his name and the name of a company he created to launder about $2.5 million, prosecutors said.

title: Roger Federer to Miss Australian Open and All but Rules Out Wimbledon
content: Recovering from his fourth knee operation, Federer, at 40, has no illusions about winning a 21st major title. He wants to return for different reasons.

title: Mon Laferte Wants to Give You Goose Bumps
content: The Chilean songwriter released two very different albums in 2021 and is nominated for four Latin Grammy Awards on Thursday night.

title: The ‘Fearless Girl’ Statue Is in Limbo
content: Its permit expires on Nov. 29, but the statue famous for staring down the New York Stock Exchange won’t get a city hearing on a more permanent home until December, at the earliest.

title: The World Cup Loses Its First Star
content: Norway’s failure to qualify for Qatar means Erling Haaland will have to watch from home. Norway has taken it in stride.

title: Maureen Cleave, Pop Journalist and Beatles Confidante, Dies at 87
content: Ms. Cleave’s interview with John Lennon, in which he said the Beatles were “more popular than Jesus,” drew worldwide attention.

content: A queer woman who once shunned tradition discovers domestic calm in uncertain times.

title: All Babies Cry, but How Much Is Too Much?
content: Babies with colic can be incredibly challenging, but thankfully the condition ends on its own.

title: Keeping Kids Curious About Their Bodies Without Shame
content: It’s natural and entirely harmless for young children to explore. But it’s also important for parents to set boundaries.
